caption:
This photograph captures a moment of daily life featuring a yellow school bus labeled "NEW ULM SCHOOLS" parked along a curb. A school staff member, possibly the bus driver, stands in the open doorway of the bus, facing inward, slightly leaning towards the interior. On the sidewalk in front of the bus, two children are visible; one is about to board the bus and another is moving away from it. This suggests the children are either getting off or readying to board the bus.

The scene takes place in a suburban area, indicated by the presence of manicured lawns and residential structures in the background. The street is devoid of moving traffic, adding a calm, routine feel to the setting. The sunlight casts shadows of leafless tree branches onto the side of the bus, suggesting it's possibly either autumn or winter without snow. The photograph has a somewhat muted color palette, characteristic of the film photography of earlier decades.
title: Students arriving by schoolbus at cathedral senior high school in New Ulm, Minnesota.  The town is a county seat trading center of 13,000 in a farming area of south central Minnesota.  It was founded in 1854 by a german immigrant land company that encouraged its kinsmen to emigrate from europe.  Several manufacturing firms have arrived since 1950 and have helped the community to grow.  The business district was revitalized in the 1960's with community effort
